oai_dc:dc.dc:title: City Market House, c.1940s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the City Market House, c.1940s. Completed circa 1937, the structure was built on the north side of Public Square in downtown Nashville, and designed by architect Henry C. Hibbs and constructed by Foster and Creighton General Contractors. This structure is build of brick on a concrete frame, with its pitched roof of copper with a dome extending up from a flat roof around the edge of the building. In later years, the building was enlarged and became the Ben West Municipal Building. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
